citations.narrative:
The licensee was not able to produce an up-to-date APHIS form 7005 (Dogs on Hand) during the inspection. Thirty-eight
dogs were missing from the form. Properly completed acquisition records are necessary for identification of dogs to
facilitate record-keeping requirements for inventory, disposition, transport, and healthcare. The licensee must update the
Record of Acquisition and maintain the record on a regular basis so that it always has accurate information regarding
acquisition, identification, and disposition for all dogs. TO BE CORRECTED BY JUNE 1, 2024.

The licensee is using cloth towels as additional wind breaks over the metal doggie doors in the sheltered building. The
towels have excess dirt and grime on them and the licensee stated that she is not routinely cleaning or replacing these
towels. Dirt and grime harbor organisms that can cause disease in dogs. The licensee must ensure that surfaces that
come in contact with the dogs are cleaned and sanitized at least every 2 weeks or more often as necessary to satisfy
generally accepted husbandry standards and practices. TO BE CORRECTED BY JUNE 1, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee was not able to produce an up-to-date APHIS form 7005 (Dogs on Hand) during the inspection. Thirty-eight 
dogs were missing from the form. Properly completed acquisition records are necessary for identification of dogs to 
facilitate record-keeping requirements for inventory, disposition, transport, and healthcare. The licensee must update the 
Record of Acquisition and maintain the record on a regular basis so that it always has accurate information regarding 
acquisition, identification, and disposition for all dogs. TO BE CORRECTED BY JUNE 1, 2024. 
3.1(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The licensee is using cloth towels as additional wind breaks over the metal doggie doors in the sheltered building. The 
towels have excess dirt and grime on them and the licensee stated that she is not routinely cleaning or replacing these 
towels. Dirt and grime harbor organisms that can cause disease in dogs. The licensee must ensure that surfaces that 
come in contact with the dogs are cleaned and sanitized at least every 2 weeks or more often as necessary to satisfy 
generally accepted husbandry standards and practices. TO BE CORRECTED BY JUNE 1, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
